queue.metaTitle: Fix d3dx9_43.dll Missing in Black Myth Wukong [2025 Guide] | FixMissingDLL
queue.metaDescription: d3dx9_43.dll is missing error in Black Myth Wukong? Complete step-by-step guide to fix this DLL error. Official download links included. Windows 10/11 compatible.
queue.excerpt: Complete guide to fix the "d3dx9_43.dll is missing" error when launching Black Myth Wukong. Includes official download links, registry fixes, and troubleshooting steps.
queue.author: DLL Fix Expert
keywords: Black Myth Wukong crash on startup

sections.heading: Why Does Black Myth Wukong Show "d3dx9_43.dll is Missing"?
sections.content:
When you try to launch Black Myth Wukong, Windows cannot find the **d3dx9_43.dll** file that the game needs to run. This is a DirectX component (Direct3D 9 extension library).

The error typically appears as:

> "The program can't start because d3dx9_43.dll is missing from your computer. Try reinstalling the program to fix this problem."

**Common causes:**
- DirectX End-User Runtime is not installed or corrupted
- Antivirus software quarantined the DLL file
- Incomplete game installation
- Windows system file corruption

**Good news:** This is one of the most common PC gaming errors and is easy to fix!

sections.heading: Solution 1: Install DirectX End-User Runtime (Recommended)
sections.content:
The safest and most effective way to fix this error is to install the official runtime from Microsoft:

**Step-by-step:**
1. Download from: [https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=35](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=35)
2. Close Black Myth Wukong completely
3. Run the installer **as Administrator** (right-click ‚Üí Run as administrator)
4. Follow the installation wizard
5. Restart your computer
6. Try launching Black Myth Wukong again

**üí° Pro Tip:** Install BOTH x64 (64-bit) and x86 (32-bit) versions for maximum compatibility. Some games use both!

sections.heading: Solution 2: Download DLL from FixMissingDLL.com
sections.content:
If the runtime installation doesn't work, you can download **d3dx9_43.dll** directly from our secure server:

1. Go to our [d3dx9_43.dll download page](/dll/d3dx9_43/)
2. Select the correct version:
   - **64-bit** for most modern games
   - **32-bit** for older games
3. Download and extract the DLL file
4. Copy to the appropriate folder:
   - **64-bit:** `C:\Windows\System32\`
   - **32-bit:** `C:\Windows\SysWOW64\`
5. Alternatively, copy to: `[Black Myth Wukong install folder]\`
6. Restart Black Myth Wukong

**‚ö†Ô∏è Security Note:** Only download DLL files from trusted sources like FixMissingDLL.com.

sections.heading: Solution 3: Verify Black Myth Wukong Game Files
sections.content:
Corrupted or incomplete game files can cause DLL errors. Here's how to verify:

**Steam:**
1. Open Steam Library
2. Right-click **Black Myth Wukong**
3. Select **Properties** ‚Üí **Installed Files**
4. Click **"Verify integrity of game files"**
5. Wait for the process to complete (may take several minutes)

**Epic Games:**
1. Open Epic Games Launcher
2. Find **Black Myth Wukong** in your Library
3. Click the **three dots (...)** next to it
4. Select **Manage** ‚Üí **Verify**

**Xbox/Microsoft Store:**
1. Open Xbox app
2. Go to **My Games**
3. Right-click **Black Myth Wukong**
4. Select **Manage** ‚Üí **Files** ‚Üí **Verify and repair**

sections.heading: Solution 4: Run System File Checker
sections.content:
Windows has built-in tools to repair corrupted system files:

**Run SFC Scan:**
1. Press `Win + X` and select **Terminal (Admin)** or **Command Prompt (Admin)**
2. Type: `sfc /scannow`
3. Press Enter and wait for the scan to complete
4. Restart your computer

**If SFC finds issues, run DISM:**
```
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth
```

This may take 10-20 minutes. Be patient!

sections.heading: Solution 5: Check Antivirus Settings
sections.content:
Sometimes antivirus software mistakenly blocks or quarantines DLL files:

1. Open your antivirus software (Windows Defender, Norton, McAfee, etc.)
2. Check the **Quarantine** or **Virus Chest** section
3. Look for **d3dx9_43.dll** or Black Myth Wukong files
4. If found, **restore** the files
5. Add Black Myth Wukong's installation folder to the **exclusion list**

**Windows Defender:**
- Settings ‚Üí Privacy & security ‚Üí Windows Security ‚Üí Virus & threat protection
- Click "Manage settings" ‚Üí Add or remove exclusions

faq.question: Why does Black Myth Wukong say d3dx9_43.dll is missing?
faq.answer: Black Myth Wukong requires d3dx9_43.dll (part of DirectX End-User Runtime) to run properly. This error occurs when the file is missing, corrupted, or blocked by security software. Installing the correct runtime package usually fixes this issue.

faq.question: Is it safe to download d3dx9_43.dll from the internet?
faq.answer: Only download DLL files from trusted sources like FixMissingDLL.com or install the official DirectX End-User Runtime from Microsoft. Never download DLLs from unknown websites as they may contain malware.

faq.question: Will reinstalling Black Myth Wukong fix the d3dx9_43.dll error?
faq.answer: Reinstalling the game might help, but it's not the most efficient solution. Since d3dx9_43.dll is a Windows/runtime component (not part of the game), installing DirectX End-User Runtime first is recommended.

faq.question: I installed the runtime but still get the error. What now?
faq.answer: Try these steps: 1) Install BOTH 32-bit and 64-bit versions of the runtime, 2) Verify game files through Steam/Epic, 3) Check if antivirus is blocking the file, 4) Run Windows System File Checker (sfc /scannow).

faq.question: Does this fix work on Windows 11?
faq.answer: Yes! All solutions in this guide work on Windows 10, Windows 11, and even Windows 7/8. The DirectX End-User Runtime is compatible with all modern Windows versions.

sections.content:
When you try to launch Black Myth Wukong, Windows cannot find the **PhysXLoader.dll** file that the game needs to run. This is a Physics component (NVIDIA PhysX physics engine).

The error typically appears as:

> "The program can't start because PhysXLoader.dll is missing from your computer. Try reinstalling the program to fix this problem."

**Common causes:**
- NVIDIA PhysX is not installed or corrupted
- Antivirus software quarantined the DLL file
- Incomplete game installation
- Windows system file corruption

**Good news:** This is one of the most common PC gaming errors and is easy to fix!

sections.heading: Solution 1: Install NVIDIA PhysX (Recommended)
sections.content:
The safest and most effective way to fix this error is to install the official runtime from Microsoft:

**Step-by-step:**
1. Download from: [https://www.nvidia.com/en-us/drivers/physx/physx-9-19-0218-driver/](https://www.nvidia.com/en-us/drivers/physx/physx-9-19-0218-driver/)
2. Close Black Myth Wukong completely
3. Run the installer **as Administrator** (right-click ‚Üí Run as administrator)
4. Follow the installation wizard
5. Restart your computer
6. Try launching Black Myth Wukong again

**üí° Pro Tip:** Install BOTH x64 (64-bit) and x86 (32-bit) versions for maximum compatibility. Some games use both!

sections.heading: Solution 2: Download DLL from FixMissingDLL.com
sections.content:
If the runtime installation doesn't work, you can download **PhysXLoader.dll** directly from our secure server:

1. Go to our [PhysXLoader.dll download page](/dll/physxloader/)
2. Select the correct version:
   - **64-bit** for most modern games
   - **32-bit** for older games
3. Download and extract the DLL file
4. Copy to the appropriate folder:
   - **64-bit:** `C:\Windows\System32\`
   - **32-bit:** `C:\Windows\SysWOW64\`
5. Alternatively, copy to: `[Black Myth Wukong install folder]\`
6. Restart Black Myth Wukong

**‚ö†Ô∏è Security Note:** Only download DLL files from trusted sources like FixMissingDLL.com.

sections.heading: Solution 3: Verify Black Myth Wukong Game Files
sections.content:
Corrupted or incomplete game files can cause DLL errors. Here's how to verify:

**Steam:**
1. Open Steam Library
2. Right-click **Black Myth Wukong**
3. Select **Properties** ‚Üí **Installed Files**
4. Click **"Verify integrity of game files"**
5. Wait for the process to complete (may take several minutes)

**Epic Games:**
1. Open Epic Games Launcher
2. Find **Black Myth Wukong** in your Library
3. Click the **three dots (...)** next to it
4. Select **Manage** ‚Üí **Verify**

**Xbox/Microsoft Store:**
1. Open Xbox app
2. Go to **My Games**
3. Right-click **Black Myth Wukong**
4. Select **Manage** ‚Üí **Files** ‚Üí **Verify and repair**

sections.heading: Solution 4: Run System File Checker
sections.content:
Windows has built-in tools to repair corrupted system files:

**Run SFC Scan:**
1. Press `Win + X` and select **Terminal (Admin)** or **Command Prompt (Admin)**
2. Type: `sfc /scannow`
3. Press Enter and wait for the scan to complete
4. Restart your computer

**If SFC finds issues, run DISM:**
```
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth
```

This may take 10-20 minutes. Be patient!

sections.heading: Solution 5: Check Antivirus Settings
sections.content:
Sometimes antivirus software mistakenly blocks or quarantines DLL files:

1. Open your antivirus software (Windows Defender, Norton, McAfee, etc.)
2. Check the **Quarantine** or **Virus Chest** section
3. Look for **PhysXLoader.dll** or Black Myth Wukong files
4. If found, **restore** the files
5. Add Black Myth Wukong's installation folder to the **exclusion list**

**Windows Defender:**
- Settings ‚Üí Privacy & security ‚Üí Windows Security ‚Üí Virus & threat protection
- Click "Manage settings" ‚Üí Add or remove exclusions

faq.question: Why does Black Myth Wukong say PhysXLoader.dll is missing?
faq.answer: Black Myth Wukong requires PhysXLoader.dll (part of NVIDIA PhysX) to run properly. This error occurs when the file is missing, corrupted, or blocked by security software. Installing the correct runtime package usually fixes this issue.

faq.question: Is it safe to download PhysXLoader.dll from the internet?
faq.answer: Only download DLL files from trusted sources like FixMissingDLL.com or install the official NVIDIA PhysX from Microsoft. Never download DLLs from unknown websites as they may contain malware.

faq.question: Will reinstalling Black Myth Wukong fix the PhysXLoader.dll error?
faq.answer: Reinstalling the game might help, but it's not the most efficient solution. Since PhysXLoader.dll is a Windows/runtime component (not part of the game), installing NVIDIA PhysX first is recommended.

faq.question: I installed the runtime but still get the error. What now?
faq.answer: Try these steps: 1) Install BOTH 32-bit and 64-bit versions of the runtime, 2) Verify game files through Steam/Epic, 3) Check if antivirus is blocking the file, 4) Run Windows System File Checker (sfc /scannow).

faq.question: Does this fix work on Windows 11?
faq.answer: Yes! All solutions in this guide work on Windows 10, Windows 11, and even Windows 7/8. The NVIDIA PhysX is compatible with all modern Windows versions.

sections.heading: Why Does Elden Ring Show "MSVCP120.dll is Missing"?
sections.content:
When you try to launch Elden Ring, Windows cannot find the **MSVCP120.dll** file that the game needs to run. This is a Visual C++ component (Microsoft Visual C++ 2013 runtime library).

The error typically appears as:

> "The program can't start because MSVCP120.dll is missing from your computer. Try reinstalling the program to fix this problem."

**Common causes:**
- Visual C++ 2013 Redistributable is not installed or corrupted
- Antivirus software quarantined the DLL file
- Incomplete game installation
- Windows system file corruption

**Good news:** This is one of the most common PC gaming errors and is easy to fix!

sections.heading: Solution 1: Install Visual C++ 2013 Redistributable (Recommended)
sections.content:
The safest and most effective way to fix this error is to install the official runtime from Microsoft:

**Step-by-step:**
1. Download from: [https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=40784](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=40784)
2. Close Elden Ring completely
3. Run the installer **as Administrator** (right-click ‚Üí Run as administrator)
4. Follow the installation wizard
5. Restart your computer
6. Try launching Elden Ring again

**üí° Pro Tip:** Install BOTH x64 (64-bit) and x86 (32-bit) versions for maximum compatibility. Some games use both!

sections.heading: Solution 2: Download DLL from FixMissingDLL.com
sections.content:
If the runtime installation doesn't work, you can download **MSVCP120.dll** directly from our secure server:

1. Go to our [MSVCP120.dll download page](/dll/msvcp120/)
2. Select the correct version:
   - **64-bit** for most modern games
   - **32-bit** for older games
3. Download and extract the DLL file
4. Copy to the appropriate folder:
   - **64-bit:** `C:\Windows\System32\`
   - **32-bit:** `C:\Windows\SysWOW64\`
5. Alternatively, copy to: `[Elden Ring install folder]\`
6. Restart Elden Ring

**‚ö†Ô∏è Security Note:** Only download DLL files from trusted sources like FixMissingDLL.com.

sections.heading: Solution 3: Verify Elden Ring Game Files
sections.content:
Corrupted or incomplete game files can cause DLL errors. Here's how to verify:

**Steam:**
1. Open Steam Library
2. Right-click **Elden Ring**
3. Select **Properties** ‚Üí **Installed Files**
4. Click **"Verify integrity of game files"**
5. Wait for the process to complete (may take several minutes)

**Epic Games:**
1. Open Epic Games Launcher
2. Find **Elden Ring** in your Library
3. Click the **three dots (...)** next to it
4. Select **Manage** ‚Üí **Verify**

**Xbox/Microsoft Store:**
1. Open Xbox app
2. Go to **My Games**
3. Right-click **Elden Ring**
4. Select **Manage** ‚Üí **Files** ‚Üí **Verify and repair**

sections.heading: Solution 4: Run System File Checker
sections.content:
Windows has built-in tools to repair corrupted system files:

**Run SFC Scan:**
1. Press `Win + X` and select **Terminal (Admin)** or **Command Prompt (Admin)**
2. Type: `sfc /scannow`
3. Press Enter and wait for the scan to complete
4. Restart your computer

**If SFC finds issues, run DISM:**
```
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth
```

This may take 10-20 minutes. Be patient!

sections.heading: Solution 5: Check Antivirus Settings
sections.content:
Sometimes antivirus software mistakenly blocks or quarantines DLL files:

1. Open your antivirus software (Windows Defender, Norton, McAfee, etc.)
2. Check the **Quarantine** or **Virus Chest** section
3. Look for **MSVCP120.dll** or Elden Ring files
4. If found, **restore** the files
5. Add Elden Ring's installation folder to the **exclusion list**

**Windows Defender:**
- Settings ‚Üí Privacy & security ‚Üí Windows Security ‚Üí Virus & threat protection
- Click "Manage settings" ‚Üí Add or remove exclusions

sections.heading: Why Does Elden Ring Show "PhysXLoader.dll is Missing"?
sections.content:
When you try to launch Elden Ring, Windows cannot find the **PhysXLoader.dll** file that the game needs to run. This is a Physics component (NVIDIA PhysX physics engine).

The error typically appears as:

> "The program can't start because PhysXLoader.dll is missing from your computer. Try reinstalling the program to fix this problem."

**Common causes:**
- NVIDIA PhysX is not installed or corrupted
- Antivirus software quarantined the DLL file
- Incomplete game installation
- Windows system file corruption

**Good news:** This is one of the most common PC gaming errors and is easy to fix!

sections.heading: Solution 1: Install NVIDIA PhysX (Recommended)
sections.content:
The safest and most effective way to fix this error is to install the official runtime from Microsoft:

**Step-by-step:**
1. Download from: [https://www.nvidia.com/en-us/drivers/physx/physx-9-19-0218-driver/](https://www.nvidia.com/en-us/drivers/physx/physx-9-19-0218-driver/)
2. Close Elden Ring completely
3. Run the installer **as Administrator** (right-click ‚Üí Run as administrator)
4. Follow the installation wizard
5. Restart your computer
6. Try launching Elden Ring again

**üí° Pro Tip:** Install BOTH x64 (64-bit) and x86 (32-bit) versions for maximum compatibility. Some games use both!

sections.heading: Solution 2: Download DLL from FixMissingDLL.com
sections.content:
If the runtime installation doesn't work, you can download **PhysXLoader.dll** directly from our secure server:

1. Go to our [PhysXLoader.dll download page](/dll/physxloader/)
2. Select the correct version:
   - **64-bit** for most modern games
   - **32-bit** for older games
3. Download and extract the DLL file
4. Copy to the appropriate folder:
   - **64-bit:** `C:\Windows\System32\`
   - **32-bit:** `C:\Windows\SysWOW64\`
5. Alternatively, copy to: `[Elden Ring install folder]\`
6. Restart Elden Ring

**‚ö†Ô∏è Security Note:** Only download DLL files from trusted sources like FixMissingDLL.com.

sections.heading: Solution 3: Verify Elden Ring Game Files
sections.content:
Corrupted or incomplete game files can cause DLL errors. Here's how to verify:

**Steam:**
1. Open Steam Library
2. Right-click **Elden Ring**
3. Select **Properties** ‚Üí **Installed Files**
4. Click **"Verify integrity of game files"**
5. Wait for the process to complete (may take several minutes)

**Epic Games:**
1. Open Epic Games Launcher
2. Find **Elden Ring** in your Library
3. Click the **three dots (...)** next to it
4. Select **Manage** ‚Üí **Verify**

**Xbox/Microsoft Store:**
1. Open Xbox app
2. Go to **My Games**
3. Right-click **Elden Ring**
4. Select **Manage** ‚Üí **Files** ‚Üí **Verify and repair**

sections.heading: Solution 4: Run System File Checker
sections.content:
Windows has built-in tools to repair corrupted system files:

**Run SFC Scan:**
1. Press `Win + X` and select **Terminal (Admin)** or **Command Prompt (Admin)**
2. Type: `sfc /scannow`
3. Press Enter and wait for the scan to complete
4. Restart your computer

**If SFC finds issues, run DISM:**
```
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth
```

This may take 10-20 minutes. Be patient!

sections.heading: Solution 5: Check Antivirus Settings
sections.content:
Sometimes antivirus software mistakenly blocks or quarantines DLL files:

1. Open your antivirus software (Windows Defender, Norton, McAfee, etc.)
2. Check the **Quarantine** or **Virus Chest** section
3. Look for **PhysXLoader.dll** or Elden Ring files
4. If found, **restore** the files
5. Add Elden Ring's installation folder to the **exclusion list**

**Windows Defender:**
- Settings ‚Üí Privacy & security ‚Üí Windows Security ‚Üí Virus & threat protection
- Click "Manage settings" ‚Üí Add or remove exclusions

**If SFC finds issues, run DISM:**
```
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth
```

If the runtime installation doesn't work, you can download **MSVCP110.dll** directly from our secure server:

1. Go to our [MSVCP110.dll download page](/dll/msvcp110/)
2. Select the correct version:
   - **64-bit** for most modern games
   - **32-bit** for older games
3. Download and extract the DLL file
4. Copy to the appropriate folder:
   - **64-bit:** `C:\Windows\System32\`
   - **32-bit:** `C:\Windows\SysWOW64\`

sections.heading: Solution 3: Verify Baldurs Gate 3 Game Files
sections.content:
Corrupted or incomplete game files can cause DLL errors. Here's how to verify:

**Steam:**
1. Open Steam Library
2. Right-click **Baldurs Gate 3**
3. Select **Properties** ‚Üí **Installed Files**
4. Click **"Verify integrity of game files"**
5. Wait for the process to complete (may take several minutes)

**Epic Games:**
1. Open Epic Games Launcher
2. Find **Baldurs Gate 3** in your Library
3. Click the **three dots (...)** next to it
4. Select **Manage** ‚Üí **Verify**

**Xbox/Microsoft Store:**
1. Open Xbox app
2. Go to **My Games**
3. Right-click **Baldurs Gate 3**
4. Select **Manage** ‚Üí **Files** ‚Üí **Verify and repair**

sections.heading: Solution 4: Run System File Checker
sections.content:
Windows has built-in tools to repair corrupted system files:

**Run SFC Scan:**
1. Press `Win + X` and select **Terminal (Admin)** or **Command Prompt (Admin)**
2. Type: `sfc /scannow`
3. Press Enter and wait for the scan to complete
4. Restart your computer

**If SFC finds issues, run DISM:**
```
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth
```

This may take 10-20 minutes. Be patient!

sections.heading: Solution 5: Check Antivirus Settings
sections.content:
Sometimes antivirus software mistakenly blocks or quarantines DLL files:

1. Open your antivirus software (Windows Defender, Norton, McAfee, etc.)
2. Check the **Quarantine** or **Virus Chest** section
3. Look for **MSVCP110.dll** or Baldurs Gate 3 files
4. If found, **restore** the files
5. Add Baldurs Gate 3's installation folder to the **exclusion list**

**Windows Defender:**
- Settings ‚Üí Privacy & security ‚Üí Windows Security ‚Üí Virus & threat protection
- Click "Manage settings" ‚Üí Add or remove exclusions

faq.question: Why does Baldurs Gate 3 say MSVCP110.dll is missing?
faq.answer: Baldurs Gate 3 requires MSVCP110.dll (part of Visual C++ 2012 Redistributable) to run properly. This error occurs when the file is missing, corrupted, or blocked by security software. Installing the correct runtime package usually fixes this issue.

faq.question: Is it safe to download MSVCP110.dll from the internet?
faq.answer: Only download DLL files from trusted sources like FixMissingDLL.com or install the official Visual C++ 2012 Redistributable from Microsoft. Never download DLLs from unknown websites as they may contain malware.

faq.question: Will reinstalling Baldurs Gate 3 fix the MSVCP110.dll error?
faq.answer: Reinstalling the game might help, but it's not the most efficient solution. Since MSVCP110.dll is a Windows/runtime component (not part of the game), installing Visual C++ 2012 Redistributable first is recommended.

faq.answer: Try these steps: 1) Install BOTH 32-bit and 64-bit versions of the runtime, 2) Verify game files through Steam/Epic, 3) Check if antivirus is blocking the file, 4) Run Windows System File Checker (sfc /scannow).

faq.question: Does this fix work on Windows 11?
faq.answer: Yes! All solutions in this guide work on Windows 10, Windows 11, and even Windows 7/8. The Visual C++ 2012 Redistributable is compatible with all modern Windows versions.

sections.heading: Why Does Baldurs Gate 3 Show "d3dx11_43.dll is Missing"?
sections.content:
When you try to launch Baldurs Gate 3, Windows cannot find the **d3dx11_43.dll** file that the game needs to run. This is a DirectX component (Direct3D 11 extension library).

The error typically appears as:

> "The program can't start because d3dx11_43.dll is missing from your computer. Try reinstalling the program to fix this problem."

**Common causes:**
- DirectX End-User Runtime is not installed or corrupted
- Antivirus software quarantined the DLL file
- Incomplete game installation
- Windows system file corruption

**Good news:** This is one of the most common PC gaming errors and is easy to fix!

sections.heading: Solution 1: Install DirectX End-User Runtime (Recommended)
sections.content:
The safest and most effective way to fix this error is to install the official runtime from Microsoft:

**Step-by-step:**
1. Download from: [https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=35](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=35)
2. Close Baldurs Gate 3 completely
3. Run the installer **as Administrator** (right-click ‚Üí Run as administrator)
4. Follow the installation wizard
5. Restart your computer
6. Try launching Baldurs Gate 3 again

**üí° Pro Tip:** Install BOTH x64 (64-bit) and x86 (32-bit) versions for maximum compatibility. Some games use both!

sections.heading: Solution 2: Download DLL from FixMissingDLL.com
sections.content:
If the runtime installation doesn't work, you can download **d3dx11_43.dll** directly from our secure server:

1. Go to our [d3dx11_43.dll download page](/dll/d3dx11_43/)
2. Select the correct version:
   - **64-bit** for most modern games
   - **32-bit** for older games
3. Download and extract the DLL file
4. Copy to the appropriate folder:
   - **64-bit:** `C:\Windows\System32\`
   - **32-bit:** `C:\Windows\SysWOW64\`
5. Alternatively, copy to: `[Baldurs Gate 3 install folder]\`
6. Restart Baldurs Gate 3

**‚ö†Ô∏è Security Note:** Only download DLL files from trusted sources like FixMissingDLL.com.

sections.heading: Solution 3: Verify Baldurs Gate 3 Game Files
sections.content:
Corrupted or incomplete game files can cause DLL errors. Here's how to verify:

**Steam:**
1. Open Steam Library
2. Right-click **Baldurs Gate 3**
3. Select **Properties** ‚Üí **Installed Files**
4. Click **"Verify integrity of game files"**
5. Wait for the process to complete (may take several minutes)

**Epic Games:**
1. Open Epic Games Launcher
2. Find **Baldurs Gate 3** in your Library
3. Click the **three dots (...)** next to it
4. Select **Manage** ‚Üí **Verify**

**Xbox/Microsoft Store:**
1. Open Xbox app
2. Go to **My Games**
3. Right-click **Baldurs Gate 3**
4. Select **Manage** ‚Üí **Files** ‚Üí **Verify and repair**

sections.heading: Solution 4: Run System File Checker
sections.content:
Windows has built-in tools to repair corrupted system files:

**Run SFC Scan:**
1. Press `Win + X` and select **Terminal (Admin)** or **Command Prompt (Admin)**
2. Type: `sfc /scannow`
3. Press Enter and wait for the scan to complete
4. Restart your computer

**If SFC finds issues, run DISM:**
```
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth
```

This may take 10-20 minutes. Be patient!

sections.heading: Solution 5: Check Antivirus Settings
sections.content:
Sometimes antivirus software mistakenly blocks or quarantines DLL files:

1. Open your antivirus software (Windows Defender, Norton, McAfee, etc.)
2. Check the **Quarantine** or **Virus Chest** section
3. Look for **d3dx11_43.dll** or Baldurs Gate 3 files
4. If found, **restore** the files
5. Add Baldurs Gate 3's installation folder to the **exclusion list**

**Windows Defender:**
- Settings ‚Üí Privacy & security ‚Üí Windows Security ‚Üí Virus & threat protection
- Click "Manage settings" ‚Üí Add or remove exclusions

faq.question: Why does Baldurs Gate 3 say d3dx11_43.dll is missing?
faq.answer: Baldurs Gate 3 requires d3dx11_43.dll (part of DirectX End-User Runtime) to run properly. This error occurs when the file is missing, corrupted, or blocked by security software. Installing the correct runtime package usually fixes this issue.

faq.question: Is it safe to download d3dx11_43.dll from the internet?
faq.answer: Only download DLL files from trusted sources like FixMissingDLL.com or install the official DirectX End-User Runtime from Microsoft. Never download DLLs from unknown websites as they may contain malware.

faq.question: Will reinstalling Baldurs Gate 3 fix the d3dx11_43.dll error?
faq.answer: Reinstalling the game might help, but it's not the most efficient solution. Since d3dx11_43.dll is a Windows/runtime component (not part of the game), installing DirectX End-User Runtime first is recommended.

faq.question: I installed the runtime but still get the error. What now?
faq.answer: Try these steps: 1) Install BOTH 32-bit and 64-bit versions of the runtime, 2) Verify game files through Steam/Epic, 3) Check if antivirus is blocking the file, 4) Run Windows System File Checker (sfc /scannow).

faq.answer: Yes! All solutions in this guide work on Windows 10, Windows 11, and even Windows 7/8. The DirectX End-User Runtime is compatible with all modern Windows versions.

sections.heading: Why Does Baldurs Gate 3 Show "ucrtbase.dll is Missing"?

sections.heading: Solution 2: Download DLL from FixMissingDLL.com
sections.content:

sections.heading: Solution 3: Verify Baldurs Gate 3 Game Files
sections.content:
Corrupted or incomplete game files can cause DLL errors. Here's how to verify:

**Steam:**
1. Open Steam Library
2. Right-click **Baldurs Gate 3**
3. Select **Properties** ‚Üí **Installed Files**
4. Click **"Verify integrity of game files"**
5. Wait for the process to complete (may take several minutes)

**Epic Games:**
1. Open Epic Games Launcher
2. Find **Baldurs Gate 3** in your Library
3. Click the **three dots (...)** next to it
4. Select **Manage** ‚Üí **Verify**

**Xbox/Microsoft Store:**
1. Open Xbox app
2. Go to **My Games**
3. Right-click **Baldurs Gate 3**
4. Select **Manage** ‚Üí **Files** ‚Üí **Verify and repair**

sections.heading: Solution 4: Run System File Checker
sections.content:
Windows has built-in tools to repair corrupted system files:

**Run SFC Scan:**
1. Press `Win + X` and select **Terminal (Admin)** or **Command Prompt (Admin)**
2. Type: `sfc /scannow`
3. Press Enter and wait for the scan to complete
4. Restart your computer

**If SFC finds issues, run DISM:**
```
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth
```

This may take 10-20 minutes. Be patient!

sections.heading: Solution 5: Check Antivirus Settings
sections.content:
Sometimes antivirus software mistakenly blocks or quarantines DLL files:

1. Open your antivirus software (Windows Defender, Norton, McAfee, etc.)

3. Look for **steam_api64.dll** or Baldurs Gate 3 files
4. If found, **restore** the files
5. Add Baldurs Gate 3's installation folder to the **exclusion list**

**Windows Defender:**
- Settings ‚Üí Privacy & security ‚Üí Windows Security ‚Üí Virus & threat protection
- Click "Manage settings" ‚Üí Add or remove exclusions

queue.excerpt: Complete guide to fix the "MSVCP120.dll is missing" error when launching Starfield. Includes official download links, registry fixes, and troubleshooting steps.
queue.author: DLL Fix Expert

sections.heading: Why Does Starfield Show "MSVCP120.dll is Missing"?
sections.content:
When you try to launch Starfield, Windows cannot find the **MSVCP120.dll** file that the game needs to run. This is a Visual C++ component (Microsoft Visual C++ 2013 runtime library).

The error typically appears as:

> "The program can't start because MSVCP120.dll is missing from your computer. Try reinstalling the program to fix this problem."

**Common causes:**
- Visual C++ 2013 Redistributable is not installed or corrupted
- Antivirus software quarantined the DLL file
- Incomplete game installation
- Windows system file corruption

**Good news:** This is one of the most common PC gaming errors and is easy to fix!

sections.heading: Solution 1: Install Visual C++ 2013 Redistributable (Recommended)
sections.content:
The safest and most effective way to fix this error is to install the official runtime from Microsoft:

**Step-by-step:**
1. Download from: [https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=40784](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=40784)
2. Close Starfield completely
3. Run the installer **as Administrator** (right-click ‚Üí Run as administrator)
4. Follow the installation wizard
5. Restart your computer
6. Try launching Starfield again

**üí° Pro Tip:** Install BOTH x64 (64-bit) and x86 (32-bit) versions for maximum compatibility. Some games use both!

sections.heading: Solution 2: Download DLL from FixMissingDLL.com
sections.content:
If the runtime installation doesn't work, you can download **MSVCP120.dll** directly from our secure server:

1. Go to our [MSVCP120.dll download page](/dll/msvcp120/)
2. Select the correct version:
   - **64-bit** for most modern games
   - **32-bit** for older games
3. Download and extract the DLL file
4. Copy to the appropriate folder:
   - **64-bit:** `C:\Windows\System32\`
   - **32-bit:** `C:\Windows\SysWOW64\`
5. Alternatively, copy to: `[Starfield install folder]\`
6. Restart Starfield

**‚ö†Ô∏è Security Note:** Only download DLL files from trusted sources like FixMissingDLL.com.

sections.heading: Solution 3: Verify Starfield Game Files
sections.content:
Corrupted or incomplete game files can cause DLL errors. Here's how to verify:

**Steam:**
1. Open Steam Library
2. Right-click **Starfield**
3. Select **Properties** ‚Üí **Installed Files**
4. Click **"Verify integrity of game files"**
5. Wait for the process to complete (may take several minutes)

**Epic Games:**
1. Open Epic Games Launcher
2. Find **Starfield** in your Library
3. Click the **three dots (...)** next to it
4. Select **Manage** ‚Üí **Verify**

**Xbox/Microsoft Store:**
1. Open Xbox app
2. Go to **My Games**
3. Right-click **Starfield**
4. Select **Manage** ‚Üí **Files** ‚Üí **Verify and repair**

sections.heading: Solution 4: Run System File Checker
sections.content:
Windows has built-in tools to repair corrupted system files:

**Run SFC Scan:**
1. Press `Win + X` and select **Terminal (Admin)** or **Command Prompt (Admin)**
2. Type: `sfc /scannow`
3. Press Enter and wait for the scan to complete
4. Restart your computer

**If SFC finds issues, run DISM:**
```
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth
```

This may take 10-20 minutes. Be patient!

sections.heading: Solution 5: Check Antivirus Settings
sections.content:
Sometimes antivirus software mistakenly blocks or quarantines DLL files:

1. Open your antivirus software (Windows Defender, Norton, McAfee, etc.)
2. Check the **Quarantine** or **Virus Chest** section
3. Look for **MSVCP120.dll** or Starfield files
4. If found, **restore** the files
5. Add Starfield's installation folder to the **exclusion list**

**Windows Defender:**
- Settings ‚Üí Privacy & security ‚Üí Windows Security ‚Üí Virus & threat protection
- Click "Manage settings" ‚Üí Add or remove exclusions

faq.question: Why does Starfield say MSVCP120.dll is missing?
faq.answer: Starfield requires MSVCP120.dll (part of Visual C++ 2013 Redistributable) to run properly. This error occurs when the file is missing, corrupted, or blocked by security software. Installing the correct runtime package usually fixes this issue.

faq.question: Is it safe to download MSVCP120.dll from the internet?
faq.answer: Only download DLL files from trusted sources like FixMissingDLL.com or install the official Visual C++ 2013 Redistributable from Microsoft. Never download DLLs from unknown websites as they may contain malware.

faq.question: Will reinstalling Starfield fix the MSVCP120.dll error?
faq.answer: Reinstalling the game might help, but it's not the most efficient solution. Since MSVCP120.dll is a Windows/runtime component (not part of the game), installing Visual C++ 2013 Redistributable first is recommended.

faq.question: I installed the runtime but still get the error. What now?
faq.answer: Try these steps: 1) Install BOTH 32-bit and 64-bit versions of the runtime, 2) Verify game files through Steam/Epic, 3) Check if antivirus is blocking the file, 4) Run Windows System File Checker (sfc /scannow).

faq.question: Does this fix work on Windows 11?
faq.answer: Yes! All solutions in this guide work on Windows 10, Windows 11, and even Windows 7/8. The Visual C++ 2013 Redistributable is compatible with all modern Windows versions.

sections.heading: Why Does Starfield Show "d3dx9_43.dll is Missing"?
sections.content:
When you try to launch Starfield, Windows cannot find the **d3dx9_43.dll** file that the game needs to run. This is a DirectX component (Direct3D 9 extension library).

The error typically appears as:

> "The program can't start because d3dx9_43.dll is missing from your computer. Try reinstalling the program to fix this problem."

**Common causes:**
- DirectX End-User Runtime is not installed or corrupted
- Antivirus software quarantined the DLL file
- Incomplete game installation
- Windows system file corruption

**Good news:** This is one of the most common PC gaming errors and is easy to fix!

sections.heading: Solution 1: Install DirectX End-User Runtime (Recommended)
sections.content:
The safest and most effective way to fix this error is to install the official runtime from Microsoft:

**Step-by-step:**
1. Download from: [https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=35](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=35)
2. Close Starfield completely
3. Run the installer **as Administrator** (right-click ‚Üí Run as administrator)
4. Follow the installation wizard
5. Restart your computer
6. Try launching Starfield again

**üí° Pro Tip:** Install BOTH x64 (64-bit) and x86 (32-bit) versions for maximum compatibility. Some games use both!

sections.heading: Solution 2: Download DLL from FixMissingDLL.com
sections.content:
If the runtime installation doesn't work, you can download **d3dx9_43.dll** directly from our secure server:

1. Go to our [d3dx9_43.dll download page](/dll/d3dx9_43/)
2. Select the correct version:
   - **64-bit** for most modern games
   - **32-bit** for older games
3. Download and extract the DLL file
4. Copy to the appropriate folder:
   - **64-bit:** `C:\Windows\System32\`
   - **32-bit:** `C:\Windows\SysWOW64\`
5. Alternatively, copy to: `[Starfield install folder]\`
6. Restart Starfield

**‚ö†Ô∏è Security Note:** Only download DLL files from trusted sources like FixMissingDLL.com.

sections.heading: Solution 3: Verify Starfield Game Files
sections.content:
Corrupted or incomplete game files can cause DLL errors. Here's how to verify:

**Steam:**
1. Open Steam Library
2. Right-click **Starfield**
3. Select **Properties** ‚Üí **Installed Files**
4. Click **"Verify integrity of game files"**
5. Wait for the process to complete (may take several minutes)

**Epic Games:**
1. Open Epic Games Launcher
2. Find **Starfield** in your Library
3. Click the **three dots (...)** next to it
4. Select **Manage** ‚Üí **Verify**

**Xbox/Microsoft Store:**
1. Open Xbox app
2. Go to **My Games**
3. Right-click **Starfield**
4. Select **Manage** ‚Üí **Files** ‚Üí **Verify and repair**

sections.heading: Solution 4: Run System File Checker
sections.content:
Windows has built-in tools to repair corrupted system files:

**Run SFC Scan:**
1. Press `Win + X` and select **Terminal (Admin)** or **Command Prompt (Admin)**
2. Type: `sfc /scannow`
3. Press Enter and wait for the scan to complete
4. Restart your computer

**If SFC finds issues, run DISM:**
```
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth
```

This may take 10-20 minutes. Be patient!

sections.heading: Solution 5: Check Antivirus Settings
sections.content:
Sometimes antivirus software mistakenly blocks or quarantines DLL files:

1. Open your antivirus software (Windows Defender, Norton, McAfee, etc.)
2. Check the **Quarantine** or **Virus Chest** section
3. Look for **d3dx9_43.dll** or Starfield files
4. If found, **restore** the files
5. Add Starfield's installation folder to the **exclusion list**

**Windows Defender:**
- Settings ‚Üí Privacy & security ‚Üí Windows Security ‚Üí Virus & threat protection
- Click "Manage settings" ‚Üí Add or remove exclusions

sections.heading: Solution 3: Verify Starfield Game Files

**Steam:**

2. Right-click **Starfield**

**Epic Games:**
1. Open Epic Games Launcher
2. Find **Starfield** in your Library
3. Click the **three dots (...)** next to it

**Xbox/Microsoft Store:**

sections.heading: Solution 4: Run System File Checker
sections.content:

**Run SFC Scan:**
1. Press `Win + X` and select **Terminal (Admin)** or **Command Prompt (Admin)**

**If SFC finds issues, run DISM:**
```
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth
```

This may take 10-20 minutes. Be patient!

sections.heading: Solution 5: Check Antivirus Settings
sections.content:

**Windows Defender:**
- Settings ‚Üí Privacy & security ‚Üí Windows Security ‚Üí Virus & threat protection
- Click "Manage settings" ‚Üí Add or remove exclusions

sections.heading: Solution 1: Install Visual C++ 2013 Redistributable (Recommended)
sections.content:
The safest and most effective way to fix this error is to install the official runtime from Microsoft:

**Step-by-step:**
1. Download from: [https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=40784](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=40784)
2. Close Hogwarts Legacy completely
3. Run the installer **as Administrator** (right-click ‚Üí Run as administrator)
4. Follow the installation wizard
5. Restart your computer
6. Try launching Hogwarts Legacy again

**üí° Pro Tip:** Install BOTH x64 (64-bit) and x86 (32-bit) versions for maximum compatibility. Some games use both!

sections.heading: Solution 2: Download DLL from FixMissingDLL.com
sections.content:
If the runtime installation doesn't work, you can download **MSVCP120.dll** directly from our secure server:

1. Go to our [MSVCP120.dll download page](/dll/msvcp120/)
2. Select the correct version:
   - **64-bit** for most modern games
   - **32-bit** for older games
3. Download and extract the DLL file
4. Copy to the appropriate folder:
   - **64-bit:** `C:\Windows\System32\`
   - **32-bit:** `C:\Windows\SysWOW64\`
5. Alternatively, copy to: `[Hogwarts Legacy install folder]\`
6. Restart Hogwarts Legacy

**‚ö†Ô∏è Security Note:** Only download DLL files from trusted sources like FixMissingDLL.com.

sections.heading: Solution 3: Verify Hogwarts Legacy Game Files
sections.content:
Corrupted or incomplete game files can cause DLL errors. Here's how to verify:

**Steam:**
1. Open Steam Library
2. Right-click **Hogwarts Legacy**
3. Select **Properties** ‚Üí **Installed Files**
4. Click **"Verify integrity of game files"**
5. Wait for the process to complete (may take several minutes)

**Epic Games:**
1. Open Epic Games Launcher
2. Find **Hogwarts Legacy** in your Library
3. Click the **three dots (...)** next to it
4. Select **Manage** ‚Üí **Verify**

**Xbox/Microsoft Store:**
1. Open Xbox app
2. Go to **My Games**
3. Right-click **Hogwarts Legacy**
4. Select **Manage** ‚Üí **Files** ‚Üí **Verify and repair**

sections.heading: Solution 4: Run System File Checker
sections.content:
Windows has built-in tools to repair corrupted system files:

**Run SFC Scan:**
1. Press `Win + X` and select **Terminal (Admin)** or **Command Prompt (Admin)**
2. Type: `sfc /scannow`
3. Press Enter and wait for the scan to complete
4. Restart your computer

**If SFC finds issues, run DISM:**
```
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth
```

This may take 10-20 minutes. Be patient!

sections.heading: Solution 5: Check Antivirus Settings
sections.content:
Sometimes antivirus software mistakenly blocks or quarantines DLL files:

1. Open your antivirus software (Windows Defender, Norton, McAfee, etc.)
2. Check the **Quarantine** or **Virus Chest** section
3. Look for **MSVCP120.dll** or Hogwarts Legacy files
4. If found, **restore** the files
5. Add Hogwarts Legacy's installation folder to the **exclusion list**

**Windows Defender:**
- Settings ‚Üí Privacy & security ‚Üí Windows Security ‚Üí Virus & threat protection
- Click "Manage settings" ‚Üí Add or remove exclusions

sections.heading: Why Does Hogwarts Legacy Show "d3dx9_43.dll is Missing"?
sections.content:
When you try to launch Hogwarts Legacy, Windows cannot find the **d3dx9_43.dll** file that the game needs to run. This is a DirectX component (Direct3D 9 extension library).

The error typically appears as:

> "The program can't start because d3dx9_43.dll is missing from your computer. Try reinstalling the program to fix this problem."

**Common causes:**
- DirectX End-User Runtime is not installed or corrupted
- Antivirus software quarantined the DLL file
- Incomplete game installation
- Windows system file corruption

**Good news:** This is one of the most common PC gaming errors and is easy to fix!

sections.heading: Solution 1: Install DirectX End-User Runtime (Recommended)
sections.content:
The safest and most effective way to fix this error is to install the official runtime from Microsoft:

**Step-by-step:**
1. Download from: [https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=35](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=35)
2. Close Hogwarts Legacy completely
3. Run the installer **as Administrator** (right-click ‚Üí Run as administrator)
4. Follow the installation wizard
5. Restart your computer
6. Try launching Hogwarts Legacy again

**üí° Pro Tip:** Install BOTH x64 (64-bit) and x86 (32-bit) versions for maximum compatibility. Some games use both!

sections.heading: Solution 2: Download DLL from FixMissingDLL.com
sections.content:
If the runtime installation doesn't work, you can download **d3dx9_43.dll** directly from our secure server:

1. Go to our [d3dx9_43.dll download page](/dll/d3dx9_43/)
2. Select the correct version:
   - **64-bit** for most modern games
   - **32-bit** for older games
3. Download and extract the DLL file
4. Copy to the appropriate folder:
   - **64-bit:** `C:\Windows\System32\`
   - **32-bit:** `C:\Windows\SysWOW64\`
5. Alternatively, copy to: `[Hogwarts Legacy install folder]\`
6. Restart Hogwarts Legacy

**‚ö†Ô∏è Security Note:** Only download DLL files from trusted sources like FixMissingDLL.com.

sections.heading: Solution 3: Verify Hogwarts Legacy Game Files
sections.content:
Corrupted or incomplete game files can cause DLL errors. Here's how to verify:

**Steam:**
1. Open Steam Library
2. Right-click **Hogwarts Legacy**
3. Select **Properties** ‚Üí **Installed Files**
4. Click **"Verify integrity of game files"**
5. Wait for the process to complete (may take several minutes)

**Epic Games:**
1. Open Epic Games Launcher
2. Find **Hogwarts Legacy** in your Library
3. Click the **three dots (...)** next to it
4. Select **Manage** ‚Üí **Verify**

**Xbox/Microsoft Store:**
1. Open Xbox app
2. Go to **My Games**
3. Right-click **Hogwarts Legacy**
4. Select **Manage** ‚Üí **Files** ‚Üí **Verify and repair**

sections.heading: Solution 4: Run System File Checker
sections.content:
Windows has built-in tools to repair corrupted system files:

**Run SFC Scan:**
1. Press `Win + X` and select **Terminal (Admin)** or **Command Prompt (Admin)**
2. Type: `sfc /scannow`
3. Press Enter and wait for the scan to complete
4. Restart your computer

**If SFC finds issues, run DISM:**
```
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth
```

This may take 10-20 minutes. Be patient!

sections.heading: Solution 5: Check Antivirus Settings
sections.content:
Sometimes antivirus software mistakenly blocks or quarantines DLL files:

1. Open your antivirus software (Windows Defender, Norton, McAfee, etc.)
2. Check the **Quarantine** or **Virus Chest** section
3. Look for **d3dx9_43.dll** or Hogwarts Legacy files
4. If found, **restore** the files
5. Add Hogwarts Legacy's installation folder to the **exclusion list**

**Windows Defender:**
- Settings ‚Üí Privacy & security ‚Üí Windows Security ‚Üí Virus & threat protection
- Click "Manage settings" ‚Üí Add or remove exclusions

queue.title: How to Fix shell32.dll Error in Windows 11 startup
queue.metaTitle: Fix shell32.dll Error - Windows 11 startup [2025 Complete Guide]
queue.metaDescription: shell32.dll error affecting Windows 11 startup? Complete troubleshooting guide with SFC, DISM, and registry fixes. Works on Windows 10/11.
queue.excerpt: Resolve shell32.dll errors that cause problems with Windows 11 startup. Step-by-step repair guide using official Windows tools.
queue.author: Windows Expert

sections.heading: Understanding shell32.dll Errors in Windows 11 startup
sections.content:
**shell32.dll** is a critical Windows system file (Windows Shell common DLL). When this file becomes corrupted or missing, it can cause serious issues with Windows 11 startup.

**Common symptoms:**
- "shell32.dll is missing or not found" error
- "shell32.dll failed to load" message
- Windows 11 startup crashes or freezes
- Windows startup problems
- Blue screen errors (BSOD)

**‚ö†Ô∏è Important:** shell32.dll is a protected Windows system file. Never download it from third-party websites!

sections.heading: Solution 1: Run System File Checker (SFC)
sections.content:
The System File Checker is your first line of defense for repairing corrupted system DLLs:

**Steps:**
1. Press `Win + X` and select **Terminal (Admin)** or **Command Prompt (Admin)**
2. Type the following command and press Enter:

```
sfc /scannow
```

3. Wait for the scan to complete (this may take 10-15 minutes)
4. Look for the message:
   - ‚úÖ "Windows Resource Protection found corrupt files and successfully repaired them"
   - ‚ùå "Windows Resource Protection found corrupt files but was unable to fix some of them"
5. Restart your computer

**If SFC finds but cannot repair files, proceed to Solution 2.**

sections.heading: Solution 2: Use DISM to Repair Windows Image
sections.content:
DISM (Deployment Image Servicing and Management) can repair the Windows component store:

**Run these commands in order:**

```
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /CheckHealth
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /ScanHealth
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth
```

**‚è±Ô∏è Note:** The RestoreHealth command may take 15-30 minutes. Don't interrupt it!

After DISM completes, run SFC again:
```
sfc /scannow
```

Restart your computer and check if Windows 11 startup works correctly.

sections.heading: Solution 3: Check for Windows Updates
sections.content:
Windows updates often include fixes for system DLL issues:

**Steps:**
1. Press `Win + I` to open Settings
2. Go to **Windows Update** (or Update & Security on Win10)
3. Click **Check for updates**
4. Install all available updates
5. Restart your computer

**For stuck updates:**
```
net stop wuauserv
net stop bits
```

sections.heading: Understanding kernel32.dll Errors in Windows Update
sections.content:

- "kernel32.dll is missing or not found" error
- "kernel32.dll failed to load" message

sections.heading: Solution 1: Run System File Checker (SFC)
sections.content:
The System File Checker is your first line of defense for repairing corrupted system DLLs:

**Steps:**
1. Press `Win + X` and select **Terminal (Admin)** or **Command Prompt (Admin)**
2. Type the following command and press Enter:

```
sfc /scannow
```

3. Wait for the scan to complete (this may take 10-15 minutes)
4. Look for the message:
   - ‚úÖ "Windows Resource Protection found corrupt files and successfully repaired them"
   - ‚ùå "Windows Resource Protection found corrupt files but was unable to fix some of them"
5. Restart your computer

**If SFC finds but cannot repair files, proceed to Solution 2.**

sections.heading: Solution 2: Use DISM to Repair Windows Image
sections.content:
DISM (Deployment Image Servicing and Management) can repair the Windows component store:

**Run these commands in order:**

```
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /CheckHealth

```

**‚è±Ô∏è Note:** The RestoreHealth command may take 15-30 minutes. Don't interrupt it!

```
sfc /scannow
```

Restart your computer and check if Windows Update works correctly.

sections.heading: Solution 3: Check for Windows Updates

5. Restart your computer

**For stuck updates:**
```
net stop wuauserv
net stop bits
ren C:\Windows\SoftwareDistribution SoftwareDistribution.old
net start wuauserv
net start bits
```

Then check for updates again.

sections.heading: Solution 4: Perform a Clean Boot
sections.content:

**Steps:**
1. Press `Win + R`, type `msconfig`, press Enter
2. Go to the **Services** tab
3. Check **Hide all Microsoft services**
4. Click **Disable all**
5. Go to the **Startup** tab, click **Open Task Manager**
6. Disable all startup items
7. Restart your computer

If Windows Update works after clean boot, enable services one by one to find the culprit.

sections.heading: Understanding advapi32.dll Errors in Windows Update
sections.content:
**advapi32.dll** is a critical Windows system file (Advanced Windows 32 API - security and registry functions). When this file becomes corrupted or missing, it can cause serious issues with Windows Update.

**Common symptoms:**
- "advapi32.dll is missing or not found" error
- "advapi32.dll failed to load" message
- Windows Update crashes or freezes
- Windows startup problems
- Blue screen errors (BSOD)

**‚ö†Ô∏è Important:** advapi32.dll is a protected Windows system file. Never download it from third-party websites!

sections.heading: Solution 1: Run System File Checker (SFC)
sections.content:
The System File Checker is your first line of defense for repairing corrupted system DLLs:

**Steps:**
1. Press `Win + X` and select **Terminal (Admin)** or **Command Prompt (Admin)**
2. Type the following command and press Enter:

```
sfc /scannow
```

3. Wait for the scan to complete (this may take 10-15 minutes)
4. Look for the message:
   - ‚úÖ "Windows Resource Protection found corrupt files and successfully repaired them"
   - ‚ùå "Windows Resource Protection found corrupt files but was unable to fix some of them"
5. Restart your computer

**If SFC finds but cannot repair files, proceed to Solution 2.**

sections.heading: Solution 2: Use DISM to Repair Windows Image
sections.content:
DISM (Deployment Image Servicing and Management) can repair the Windows component store:

**Run these commands in order:**

```
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /CheckHealth
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /ScanHealth
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth
```

**‚è±Ô∏è Note:** The RestoreHealth command may take 15-30 minutes. Don't interrupt it!

After DISM completes, run SFC again:
```
sfc /scannow
```

Restart your computer and check if Windows Update works correctly.

sections.heading: Solution 3: Check for Windows Updates
sections.content:
Windows updates often include fixes for system DLL issues:

**Steps:**
1. Press `Win + I` to open Settings
2. Go to **Windows Update** (or Update & Security on Win10)
3. Click **Check for updates**
4. Install all available updates
5. Restart your computer

**For stuck updates:**
```
net stop wuauserv
net stop bits
ren C:\Windows\SoftwareDistribution SoftwareDistribution.old
net start wuauserv
net start bits
```

Then check for updates again.

sections.heading: Solution 4: Perform a Clean Boot
sections.content:
A clean boot can help identify if third-party software is interfering with advapi32.dll:

**Steps:**
1. Press `Win + R`, type `msconfig`, press Enter
2. Go to the **Services** tab
3. Check **Hide all Microsoft services**
4. Click **Disable all**
5. Go to the **Startup** tab, click **Open Task Manager**
6. Disable all startup items
7. Restart your computer

If Windows Update works after clean boot, enable services one by one to find the culprit.

sections.heading: Solution 5: Reset Windows Components
sections.content:
If Windows Update still has issues:

**Re-register the DLL:**
```
regsvr32 /u advapi32.dll
regsvr32 advapi32.dll
```

**Reset Windows Update components:**
```
net stop wuauserv
net stop cryptSvc
net stop bits
net stop msiserver
ren C:\Windows\SoftwareDistribution SoftwareDistribution.bak
ren C:\Windows\System32\catroot2 catroot2.bak
net start wuauserv
net start cryptSvc
net start bits
net start msiserver
```

sections.heading: Solution 6: System Restore or Reset
sections.content:
If nothing else works, restore Windows to a previous state:

1. Press `Win + R`, type `rstrui`, press Enter
2. Select a restore point from before the problem started
3. Follow the wizard to restore

**Reset Windows (keeps files):**
1. Settings ‚Üí System ‚Üí Recovery
2. Click **Reset PC**
3. Choose **Keep my files**
4. Select **Local reinstall** or **Cloud download**

**‚ö†Ô∏è Important:** Back up important data before any reset!

sections.heading: Understanding ws2_32.dll Errors in Windows Update
sections.content:
**ws2_32.dll** is a critical Windows system file (Windows Sockets 2.0 - network communication library). When this file becomes corrupted or missing, it can cause serious issues with Windows Update.

**Common symptoms:**
- "ws2_32.dll is missing or not found" error
- "ws2_32.dll failed to load" message
- Windows Update crashes or freezes
- Windows startup problems
- Blue screen errors (BSOD)

**‚ö†Ô∏è Important:** ws2_32.dll is a protected Windows system file. Never download it from third-party websites!

sections.heading: Solution 1: Run System File Checker (SFC)
sections.content:
The System File Checker is your first line of defense for repairing corrupted system DLLs:

**Steps:**
1. Press `Win + X` and select **Terminal (Admin)** or **Command Prompt (Admin)**
2. Type the following command and press Enter:

```
sfc /scannow
```

3. Wait for the scan to complete (this may take 10-15 minutes)
4. Look for the message:
   - ‚úÖ "Windows Resource Protection found corrupt files and successfully repaired them"
   - ‚ùå "Windows Resource Protection found corrupt files but was unable to fix some of them"
5. Restart your computer

**If SFC finds but cannot repair files, proceed to Solution 2.**

sections.heading: Solution 2: Use DISM to Repair Windows Image
sections.content:
DISM (Deployment Image Servicing and Management) can repair the Windows component store:

**Run these commands in order:**

```
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /CheckHealth
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /ScanHealth
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth
```

**‚è±Ô∏è Note:** The RestoreHealth command may take 15-30 minutes. Don't interrupt it!

After DISM completes, run SFC again:
```
sfc /scannow
```

Restart your computer and check if Windows Update works correctly.

sections.heading: Solution 3: Check for Windows Updates
sections.content:
Windows updates often include fixes for system DLL issues:

**Steps:**
1. Press `Win + I` to open Settings
2. Go to **Windows Update** (or Update & Security on Win10)
3. Click **Check for updates**
4. Install all available updates
5. Restart your computer

**For stuck updates:**
```
net stop wuauserv
net stop bits
ren C:\Windows\SoftwareDistribution SoftwareDistribution.old
net start wuauserv
net start bits
```

Then check for updates again.

sections.heading: Solution 4: Perform a Clean Boot
sections.content:
A clean boot can help identify if third-party software is interfering with ws2_32.dll:

**Steps:**
1. Press `Win + R`, type `msconfig`, press Enter
2. Go to the **Services** tab
3. Check **Hide all Microsoft services**
4. Click **Disable all**
5. Go to the **Startup** tab, click **Open Task Manager**
6. Disable all startup items
7. Restart your computer

If Windows Update works after clean boot, enable services one by one to find the culprit.

sections.heading: Solution 5: Reset Windows Components
sections.content:
If Windows Update still has issues:

**Re-register the DLL:**
```
regsvr32 /u ws2_32.dll
regsvr32 ws2_32.dll
```

**Reset Windows Update components:**
```
net stop wuauserv
net stop cryptSvc
net stop bits
net stop msiserver
ren C:\Windows\SoftwareDistribution SoftwareDistribution.bak
ren C:\Windows\System32\catroot2 catroot2.bak
net start wuauserv
net start cryptSvc
net start bits
net start msiserver
```

sections.heading: Solution 6: System Restore or Reset
sections.content:
If nothing else works, restore Windows to a previous state:

**System Restore:**
1. Press `Win + R`, type `rstrui`, press Enter
2. Select a restore point from before the problem started
3. Follow the wizard to restore

**Reset Windows (keeps files):**
1. Settings ‚Üí System ‚Üí Recovery
2. Click **Reset PC**
3. Choose **Keep my files**
4. Select **Local reinstall** or **Cloud download**

**‚ö†Ô∏è Important:** Back up important data before any reset!

queue.title: How to Fix kernel32.dll Error in Windows Explorer
queue.metaTitle: Fix kernel32.dll Error - Windows Explorer [2025 Complete Guide]
queue.metaDescription: kernel32.dll error affecting Windows Explorer? Complete troubleshooting guide with SFC, DISM, and registry fixes. Works on Windows 10/11.
queue.excerpt: Resolve kernel32.dll errors that cause problems with Windows Explorer. Step-by-step repair guide using official Windows tools.
queue.author: Windows Expert

sections.heading: Understanding kernel32.dll Errors in Windows Explorer
sections.content:
**kernel32.dll** is a critical Windows system file (Windows kernel core library - handles memory, processes, and system calls). When this file becomes corrupted or missing, it can cause serious issues with Windows Explorer.

**Common symptoms:**
- "kernel32.dll is missing or not found" error
- "kernel32.dll failed to load" message
- Windows Explorer crashes or freezes
- Windows startup problems
- Blue screen errors (BSOD)

**‚ö†Ô∏è Important:** kernel32.dll is a protected Windows system file. Never download it from third-party websites!

sections.heading: Solution 1: Run System File Checker (SFC)
sections.content:
The System File Checker is your first line of defense for repairing corrupted system DLLs:

**Steps:**
1. Press `Win + X` and select **Terminal (Admin)** or **Command Prompt (Admin)**
2. Type the following command and press Enter:

```
sfc /scannow
```

3. Wait for the scan to complete (this may take 10-15 minutes)
4. Look for the message:
   - ‚úÖ "Windows Resource Protection found corrupt files and successfully repaired them"
   - ‚ùå "Windows Resource Protection found corrupt files but was unable to fix some of them"
5. Restart your computer

**If SFC finds but cannot repair files, proceed to Solution 2.**

sections.heading: Solution 2: Use DISM to Repair Windows Image
sections.content:
DISM (Deployment Image Servicing and Management) can repair the Windows component store:

**Run these commands in order:**

```
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /CheckHealth
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /ScanHealth
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth
```

**‚è±Ô∏è Note:** The RestoreHealth command may take 15-30 minutes. Don't interrupt it!

After DISM completes, run SFC again:
```
sfc /scannow
```

Restart your computer and check if Windows Explorer works correctly.

sections.heading: Solution 3: Check for Windows Updates
sections.content:
Windows updates often include fixes for system DLL issues:

**Steps:**
1. Press `Win + I` to open Settings
2. Go to **Windows Update** (or Update & Security on Win10)
3. Click **Check for updates**
4. Install all available updates
5. Restart your computer

**For stuck updates:**
```
net stop wuauserv
net stop bits
ren C:\Windows\SoftwareDistribution SoftwareDistribution.old
net start wuauserv
net start bits
```

Then check for updates again.

sections.heading: Solution 4: Perform a Clean Boot
sections.content:
A clean boot can help identify if third-party software is interfering with kernel32.dll:

**Steps:**
1. Press `Win + R`, type `msconfig`, press Enter
2. Go to the **Services** tab
3. Check **Hide all Microsoft services**
4. Click **Disable all**
5. Go to the **Startup** tab, click **Open Task Manager**
6. Disable all startup items
7. Restart your computer

If Windows Explorer works after clean boot, enable services one by one to find the culprit.

sections.heading: Solution 5: Reset Windows Components
sections.content:
If Windows Explorer still has issues:

**Re-register the DLL:**
```
regsvr32 /u kernel32.dll
regsvr32 kernel32.dll
```

**Reset Windows Update components:**
```
net stop wuauserv
net stop cryptSvc
net stop bits
net stop msiserver
ren C:\Windows\SoftwareDistribution SoftwareDistribution.bak
ren C:\Windows\System32\catroot2 catroot2.bak
net start wuauserv
net start cryptSvc
net start bits
net start msiserver
```

sections.heading: Solution 6: System Restore or Reset
sections.content:
If nothing else works, restore Windows to a previous state:

**System Restore:**
1. Press `Win + R`, type `rstrui`, press Enter
2. Select a restore point from before the problem started
3. Follow the wizard to restore

**Reset Windows (keeps files):**
1. Settings ‚Üí System ‚Üí Recovery
2. Click **Reset PC**
3. Choose **Keep my files**
4. Select **Local reinstall** or **Cloud download**

**‚ö†Ô∏è Important:** Back up important data before any reset!

queue.title: How to Fix advapi32.dll Error in Windows Explorer
queue.metaTitle: Fix advapi32.dll Error - Windows Explorer [2025 Complete Guide]
queue.metaDescription: advapi32.dll error affecting Windows Explorer? Complete troubleshooting guide with SFC, DISM, and registry fixes. Works on Windows 10/11.
queue.excerpt: Resolve advapi32.dll errors that cause problems with Windows Explorer. Step-by-step repair guide using official Windows tools.
queue.author: Windows Expert

sections.heading: Understanding advapi32.dll Errors in Windows Explorer
sections.content:
**advapi32.dll** is a critical Windows system file (Advanced Windows 32 API - security and registry functions). When this file becomes corrupted or missing, it can cause serious issues with Windows Explorer.

**Common symptoms:**
- "advapi32.dll is missing or not found" error
- "advapi32.dll failed to load" message
- Windows Explorer crashes or freezes
- Windows startup problems
- Blue screen errors (BSOD)

**‚ö†Ô∏è Important:** advapi32.dll is a protected Windows system file. Never download it from third-party websites!

sections.heading: Solution 1: Run System File Checker (SFC)
sections.content:
The System File Checker is your first line of defense for repairing corrupted system DLLs:

**Steps:**
1. Press `Win + X` and select **Terminal (Admin)** or **Command Prompt (Admin)**
2. Type the following command and press Enter:

```
sfc /scannow
```

3. Wait for the scan to complete (this may take 10-15 minutes)
4. Look for the message:
   - ‚úÖ "Windows Resource Protection found corrupt files and successfully repaired them"
   - ‚ùå "Windows Resource Protection found corrupt files but was unable to fix some of them"
5. Restart your computer

**If SFC finds but cannot repair files, proceed to Solution 2.**

sections.heading: Solution 2: Use DISM to Repair Windows Image
sections.content:
DISM (Deployment Image Servicing and Management) can repair the Windows component store:

**Run these commands in order:**

```
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /CheckHealth
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /ScanHealth
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth
```

**‚è±Ô∏è Note:** The RestoreHealth command may take 15-30 minutes. Don't interrupt it!

After DISM completes, run SFC again:
```
sfc /scannow
```

Restart your computer and check if Windows Explorer works correctly.

sections.heading: Solution 3: Check for Windows Updates
sections.content:
Windows updates often include fixes for system DLL issues:

**Steps:**
1. Press `Win + I` to open Settings
2. Go to **Windows Update** (or Update & Security on Win10)
3. Click **Check for updates**
4. Install all available updates
5. Restart your computer

**For stuck updates:**
```
net stop wuauserv
net stop bits
ren C:\Windows\SoftwareDistribution SoftwareDistribution.old
net start wuauserv
net start bits
```

Then check for updates again.

sections.heading: Solution 4: Perform a Clean Boot
sections.content:
A clean boot can help identify if third-party software is interfering with advapi32.dll:

**Steps:**
1. Press `Win + R`, type `msconfig`, press Enter
2. Go to the **Services** tab
3. Check **Hide all Microsoft services**
4. Click **Disable all**
5. Go to the **Startup** tab, click **Open Task Manager**
6. Disable all startup items
7. Restart your computer

If Windows Explorer works after clean boot, enable services one by one to find the culprit.

sections.heading: Solution 5: Reset Windows Components
sections.content:
If Windows Explorer still has issues:

**Re-register the DLL:**
```
regsvr32 /u advapi32.dll
regsvr32 advapi32.dll
```

**Reset Windows Update components:**
```
net stop wuauserv
net stop cryptSvc
net stop bits
net stop msiserver
ren C:\Windows\SoftwareDistribution SoftwareDistribution.bak
ren C:\Windows\System32\catroot2 catroot2.bak
net start wuauserv
net start cryptSvc
net start bits
net start msiserver
```

sections.heading: Solution 6: System Restore or Reset
sections.content:
If nothing else works, restore Windows to a previous state:

**System Restore:**
1. Press `Win + R`, type `rstrui`, press Enter
2. Select a restore point from before the problem started
3. Follow the wizard to restore

**Reset Windows (keeps files):**
1. Settings ‚Üí System ‚Üí Recovery
2. Click **Reset PC**
3. Choose **Keep my files**
4. Select **Local reinstall** or **Cloud download**

**‚ö†Ô∏è Important:** Back up important data before any reset!

faq.answer: No! advapi32.dll is a protected Windows system file. Downloading DLLs from third-party sites for core Windows components is extremely dangerous and may contain malware. Always use official Windows repair tools like SFC and DISM.

This often happens after Windows updates, malware infections, or improper shutdowns.

faq.answer: It can be. Some malware targets or replaces Windows system files like advapi32.dll. Run a full scan with Windows Defender or another antivirus. If malware is found, clean it first, then repair the system files with SFC/DISM.

queue.metaTitle: Fix ws2_32.dll Error - Windows Explorer [2025 Complete Guide]
queue.metaDescription: ws2_32.dll error affecting Windows Explorer? Complete troubleshooting guide with SFC, DISM, and registry fixes. Works on Windows 10/11.
queue.excerpt: Resolve ws2_32.dll errors that cause problems with Windows Explorer. Step-by-step repair guide using official Windows tools.
queue.author: Windows Expert

sections.heading: Understanding ws2_32.dll Errors in Windows Explorer
sections.content:
**ws2_32.dll** is a critical Windows system file (Windows Sockets 2.0 - network communication library). When this file becomes corrupted or missing, it can cause serious issues with Windows Explorer.

**Common symptoms:**
- "ws2_32.dll is missing or not found" error
- "ws2_32.dll failed to load" message
- Windows Explorer crashes or freezes
- Windows startup problems
- Blue screen errors (BSOD)

**‚ö†Ô∏è Important:** ws2_32.dll is a protected Windows system file. Never download it from third-party websites!

sections.heading: Solution 1: Run System File Checker (SFC)
sections.content:
The System File Checker is your first line of defense for repairing corrupted system DLLs:

**Steps:**
1. Press `Win + X` and select **Terminal (Admin)** or **Command Prompt (Admin)**
2. Type the following command and press Enter:

```
sfc /scannow
```

3. Wait for the scan to complete (this may take 10-15 minutes)
4. Look for the message:
   - ‚úÖ "Windows Resource Protection found corrupt files and successfully repaired them"
   - ‚ùå "Windows Resource Protection found corrupt files but was unable to fix some of them"
5. Restart your computer

**If SFC finds but cannot repair files, proceed to Solution 2.**

sections.heading: Solution 2: Use DISM to Repair Windows Image
sections.content:
DISM (Deployment Image Servicing and Management) can repair the Windows component store:

**Run these commands in order:**

```
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /CheckHealth
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /ScanHealth
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth
```

**‚è±Ô∏è Note:** The RestoreHealth command may take 15-30 minutes. Don't interrupt it!

After DISM completes, run SFC again:
```
sfc /scannow
```

Restart your computer and check if Windows Explorer works correctly.

sections.heading: Solution 3: Check for Windows Updates
sections.content:
Windows updates often include fixes for system DLL issues:

**Steps:**
1. Press `Win + I` to open Settings
2. Go to **Windows Update** (or Update & Security on Win10)
3. Click **Check for updates**
4. Install all available updates
5. Restart your computer

**For stuck updates:**
```
net stop wuauserv
net stop bits
ren C:\Windows\SoftwareDistribution SoftwareDistribution.old
net start wuauserv
net start bits
```

Then check for updates again.

sections.heading: Solution 4: Perform a Clean Boot
sections.content:
A clean boot can help identify if third-party software is interfering with ws2_32.dll:

**Steps:**
1. Press `Win + R`, type `msconfig`, press Enter
2. Go to the **Services** tab
3. Check **Hide all Microsoft services**
4. Click **Disable all**
5. Go to the **Startup** tab, click **Open Task Manager**
6. Disable all startup items
7. Restart your computer

If Windows Explorer works after clean boot, enable services one by one to find the culprit.

sections.heading: Solution 5: Reset Windows Components
sections.content:
If Windows Explorer still has issues:

**Re-register the DLL:**
```
regsvr32 /u ws2_32.dll
regsvr32 ws2_32.dll
```

**Reset Windows Update components:**
```
net stop wuauserv
net stop cryptSvc
net stop bits
net stop msiserver
ren C:\Windows\SoftwareDistribution SoftwareDistribution.bak
ren C:\Windows\System32\catroot2 catroot2.bak
net start wuauserv
net start cryptSvc
net start bits
net start msiserver
```

sections.heading: Solution 6: System Restore or Reset
sections.content:
If nothing else works, restore Windows to a previous state:

**System Restore:**
1. Press `Win + R`, type `rstrui`, press Enter
2. Select a restore point from before the problem started
3. Follow the wizard to restore

**Reset Windows (keeps files):**
1. Settings ‚Üí System ‚Üí Recovery
2. Click **Reset PC**
3. Choose **Keep my files**
4. Select **Local reinstall** or **Cloud download**

**‚ö†Ô∏è Important:** Back up important data before any reset!

faq.answer: No! ws2_32.dll is a protected Windows system file. Downloading DLLs from third-party sites for core Windows components is extremely dangerous and may contain malware. Always use official Windows repair tools like SFC and DISM.

This often happens after Windows updates, malware infections, or improper shutdowns.

faq.question: Will reinstalling Windows fix the dwmapi.dll error?
faq.answer: Yes, but it's a last resort. Try SFC, DISM, and System Restore first. If those don't work, you can do an in-place upgrade (repair install) which reinstalls Windows while keeping your files and programs. A full reset is rarely needed.

faq.question: Is dwmapi.dll error a sign of malware?
faq.answer: It can be. Some malware targets or replaces Windows system files like dwmapi.dll. Run a full scan with Windows Defender or another antivirus. If malware is found, clean it first, then repair the system files with SFC/DISM.
